I'm sorry that's been your experience. 
However, there's something like over 1700 Greeks on campus (I'm going to go ahead and assume you have not personally met every single one if that's cool) so it seems like you could be missing out on potential friends. 

Again; that's over 1700 students that agree to maintain a certain GPA, work for multiple charitable organizations & causes, and (in many cases) have committed themselves to various other clubs and campus activities. 

Clearly I'm biased, but I really hope you try to keep an open mind.

#152: "I think this page was made by a sorority."

Don't give me the "She has battered woman syndrome" lecture.  She's dating a douche, and she decided to stick around.  This isn't a woman who was trapped in a marriage to a jackass, this isn't a woman who 25 years ago was stuck in a situation where there were little to no recourse.  I could understand those cases.  This is an example of a girl who is dating an athlete(IE A High Status Male), and is willing to tolerate anything from him, even psychological abuse, in order to maintain said status.  I doubt she'd be willing to deal with this from some nerdy Bio major with acne.
Frankly, I can't change him, and she can't change him.  The only thing she can control is HERSELF, and what SHE will put up with from her man.

FYI, I've been emotionally invested in things, but if the thing isn't working out, I've managed to walk away, it's not that damn complicated.  What you are basically saying is that women are too stupid/weak to stand up for themselves.  In other words, grown women are akin to children.

I'm not even going to get into the fact that she CHOSE this cretin, and then decided to stick around, even though he's a turd.  Frankly, if I were her friend, I'd tell her to either leave, or don't cry about it. I'm a no drama person, and I don't tolerate created drama.  And for the love of God, let's stop using the word "Bullied" as a buzz word.  He's a manipulative twirp, but he can only be a twirp, if she allows him to be.

In today's society, where there are TONS of organizations willing to help, one has to take some personal responsibility.  It may not be easy to leave, but eventually you have to consider it, and reach out for help.  I'm sorry, but there's a ton of people who thrive on the stupid drama of abuse, and don't walk away.  This isn't 1965 anymore, where people don't have options, and you can't stand up for yourself.  She's not married to the guy, all I'm hearing from you are excuses.  She's an adult, she needs to look out for herself and walk away.  Frankly, her friends, if it's as bad as they are letting on, need to sit her down, and hold an intervention or something.  I'm tired of hearing this "It's always someone else's fault" crap, time to grow up.  Time to start taking charge of your own life, and your own sanity.
Well, she allows it to consistently happen.  Sorry, but she gets no sympathy from me.  Have some damn pride, and move the hell on.  You deserve what you tolerate.

That's because most of the girls aren't looking for boyfriends.  To quote one of my fellow 1L's "Boyfriends are icky". The girls here would rather be the F Buddy of some sketchy Pike, than a girlfriend of a responsible, decent guy who may not be as "hot" as the douchey guys she finds in the Grove.

That is so weird Nathaniel Skinner for some reason I thought you were a guy, but by the way you keep saying "most girls this" and "all girls that," it's become obvious to me that you yourself are in fact a girl and actually know what all of "us girls" are thinking.

Also women like sex. We like to have F buddies when we feel like it. Maybe the reason you aren't finding anyone who is "girlfriend material" (WTF does that mean anyway) is because you're being so judgmental that you don't even bother to really get to know a girl before you deem her unworthy of you. Can you just relax? Relax.
Sorry for the sass, but your constant mansplaining has rustled my jimmies.

Most guys worth a crap aren't  going to allow a girl to be known as his "Girlfriend" if she's going around banging everyone.  In life, choices have consequences, and those consequences aren't always pleasant.  Despite what the founders of "Slut Walks" want you to think, being skanky does disqualify you from decent men.  Nothing wrong with hookup culture, it's just that any guy looking for a functional relationship tends to avoid the kind of woman who thinks that casual sex with any Tom, Dick and Harry that comes along is not only acceptable, but optimal. Just like most male players are lousy at maintaining a long term, monogamous relationship, the female equivalent is just as flawed.   I know you don't understand the concept of generalization, and how it can be used in a debate, so let me dumb this down for you.  There are exceptions to any rule, doesn't mean the rule doesn't apply.  For example, there's people who have survived falls from ten story buildings, doesn't change the fact that most people don't survive.  Most girls who go around whining about the lack of "good men" are also the same kind of women who truly don't have any interest in finding a "good man", because being good is somewhat boring, and it's unsexy as hell.  Most decent guys, we're too busy worrying about 10 years from now, we're too busy thinking about our futures.  We have bigger, and better things to do than get blackout drunk 4 times a week.

It's no accident that women tend to lie about their partner counts, maybe because most women understand that decent guys tend to not want to be with women who have slept around far more than they could have ever dreamed.
If you don't believe me, go look at the DOJ study on this subject.

First, I can't believe you're even able to form complete sentences considering how much pain you must be in from sitting on your high horse all night. I'd ice the boys if I were you. Also, "I know you don't understand the concept of generalization, and how it can be used in a debate, so let me dumb this down for you." Ladies and gentlemen: mansplaining at its finest. Thanks for dumbing it down, but I know what generalization is. But you seem to be the uniformed one my friend. I'm going to explain the "Slut Walks" you are referring so ignorantly to because you are severely misguided. The "Slut Walks" are actually protests that bring awareness to victim blaming in rape-cases, they are organized events to educate the public that wearing revealing clothing does not mean one is deserving of rape. "Rape pre-dates miniskirts" etc. So, before you reference "Slut Walks" like it's a shameful thing, you should get your facts straight because you just make yourself sound like a douchebag-the very thing you despise! On that note, despite what you may think, it is my experience as 20 years as a female that us women dress for ourselves: what makes us feel good, feel sexy, feel confident. For one girl it's a crop top, for the other it's a collared shirt. And we date guys that accept it. So, being skanky doesn't mean you're a slut. I dress skankily sometimes, when I want to. It makes me feel good about myself, it gives me confidence. And I'm not a slut. I'm a smart girl who occasionally parties but also enjoys intelligent conversation etc. But yeah yeah I get it, you're mature, 10 years in the future and all that sober stuff: good! totally fine. so, go. go find someone who wants the same thing but stop whining about all the people that don't want the same thing. go find someone who wants the same things and you two will make an adorable though excruciatingly self-righteous couple. I wish you both well. I just don't know what else there is to say.
Well, that escalated quickly
^lol right? I think these two should go one a date...
LOL
haha i take the "slut walks" very seriously, hence my escalation. but as far as a date is concerned, i think it's been established that i'm anything but girlfriend material.

Shaming language, the last step of a beaten person.  Again, why should any guy be with a woman who isn't disciplined enough to be selective with who she wants to sleep with? It's not about a high horse, it's about common sense.  The phrase "You don't turn a ho into a housewife" comes to mind.  I know women want to be able to have their cake and eat it too, but it's not going to happen.  If you want to have casual sex, you are welcome to, but know this.  Unless you end up snagging one of the alpha males(Which is unlikely), you are likely to end up alone.  Best case scenario is that you end up with a decent guy you have zero sexual attraction for, because he isn't as exciting or interesting as Fratty McDouchebag.

Seriously, way too much sexual frustration, just get out there and go after what you want, instead of writing a dissertation on Facebook about "human sexual behavior". You'll feel way better afterwords, I promise.
I think someone has a little bit of pent up bitterness and sexual frustration...

#93: "I can't make friends in my major because 80% of them are douchey sorority/frat people and the other 20% are Chinese students who hardly speak English. I think I'd fit in better in the sciences, but I hate science."

To whoever wrote this, don't give up hope so quickly. Life can really be tough, and there are a lot of people who get that. Sure, there are some guys who won't understand, and it sounds like you may have had some experience with them, but there are also a lot out there that will, and the scars won't stop them from seeing the real you. Going through hard times isn't something that takes away your chance of being accepted and loved. Remember, your scars don't define you.
On that note, if someone doesn't accept what you've dealt with in the past or what you're dealing with in the present, you don't want them in your future.

I guess you're right. I actually know how you feel. Most of you guys are into very thin, wild party girls (nothin wrong with that, ladies!). Guys don't want me now because I'm a little weird and I wear weird clothes sometimes and I suppose I'm outspoken and I'm not too into partying and I definitely won't have sex the same night we meet. But as soon as they mature and start thinking about what they want for their adult life, they'll want me as a wife because I'm kind and responsible, I'm honest and caring and will make a great mom and a kick-ass cook. See? See what I did? Nathaniel, I'm sorry if I've offended you. All I'm saying is, being a nice guy is great. But if you're so nice, and someone doesn't want you, it's not because you're nice, it's because something about you just isn't what they want at that time in their life. It probably has nothing to do with your levels of niceness-you might not have anything in common, she might be intimidated by you, she might not find you attractive etc. You don't go looking for people you don't want now but MIGHT want in 20 years. I was exaggerating before when i was talking about how guys don't like me now but will later in life, but I'm sure there are guys that would think the things I said. Which is totally fine and I'm not even offended or mad or anything. I don't want to be with someone who doesn't want to be with me right now, you know? Wanting different things for yourself at different times in your life is sort of the human condition. Don't blame girls that don't show interest for their interests.
